interestingcomments.content:
[P] Urban Noise Time Series Data /!/ I developed a system for urban noise analysis. I made a few sensors and a backend server to store the data. The sensors listen synchronously every second for 100ms, then they do fft on the data (i get out 16 values evenly spaced in 0-1300Hz range) and they calculate decibels. The data is then timestamped and sent to a server.

I placed 8 sensors along a busy street and have been getting data for some three weeks now. I have no clue what to do with this data.

My background is in computer science, but I know a bit of machine learning (i am familiar with regressions, tress, knn, kmeoids, kmeans, hiarchical clustering, naive bayes,...). I am quite familiar with Orange and have implemented a few ML algorithms in python. But yeah, I have no clue what to do with the data. 


I can provide the data. It's a few hundred MB of data in JSON format and I can send a dropbox link.
